column4: anyone have any idea why ubuntu would hang at 33% formatting a drive every time during install? or some workaround that would get it moving forward?
and this is a brand new drive.  i thought one i was installing on may have been bad.  got a new drive and save issue.
How long have you left it sit at 33%?
i have tried leaving it for a while.  right now i think its been sitting there the last few hours.  its just hung.  the mouse wont move, etc.  its froze.
not memory   tests fine and will run windows with no issues whatsoever
got a new one with the new drive.  so i would say no.
Have you ever previously installed Ubuntu on this same computer?
no, i have tried and failed over and over.
Maybe Ubuntu doesn't like your motherboard's SATA or IDE controller
what does lspci | grep SATA  give you for the model of your SATA controller?

i have never got it to recognize sata  it will start the install from the sata blueray but then fail to continue when you say install  so i have used a usb dvd drive to do the install and put an ide harddrive in which it does see
Oh, yeah, you definitely need a new mobo then :P
what do you think of this board?  http://www.tigerdirect.com/applications/SearchTools/item-details.asp?EdpNo=4408209&sku=A455-2876
seems to be your average run of the mill AM3 motherboard, really
How old is the motherboard that you're trying to use?
it seems to me that it may not necessarily be that Ubuntu doesn't like your chipset, but rather that it's going bad (you might not have problems with Windows even if the chipset is crapping out)
